stories.text:
Which software do you use frequently and are unable to replace (either at home or your company) despite thoroughly disliking it?

What makes it so bad? Are there alternatives? Why can't you replace it?
stories.title: Ask HN: Software you hate but can't replace?

stories.text: It blows my mind that Apple, increasingly a cloud services company, has let best-in-class-by-a-mile-when-it-isn't-broken Time Machine basically languish and deteriorate and never integrated it with iCloud storage. It feels like they could dominate a many-billion dollar cloud backup industry over night if they wanted to? I would happily pay another X dollars a month to them for proper cloud backups of someone else if it meant getting the unlimited retention and interface functionality of Time Machine. Am I crazy? Would you? Would your families?
stories.title: Ask HN: If Apple integrated Time Machine with iCloud, would you use it?
